document.heading: South Capitol Street Memorial Amendment Act of 2012

history.narrative: Law 19-141, the “South Capitol Street Memorial Amendment Act of 2012”, was introduced in Council and assigned Bill No. 19-211, which was referred to the Committee of the Whole. The Bill was adopted on first and second readings on March 6, 2012, and March 20, 2012, respectively. Signed by the Mayor on April 10, 2012, it was assigned Act No. 19-344 and transmitted to both Houses of Congress for its review. D.C. Law 19-141 became effective on June 7, 2012.
